definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: Less expensive meats can be marinated and slow cooked, so they’re tender.
sentences.chinese: 比较便宜的肉可以腌或用慢火煮，它们是柔软的。

sentences.english: Slowly add the chicken stock, wine and stir continously until boiling.
sentences.chinese: 加入鸡汤，白酒，慢火煮到开。

sentences.english: Use the simmer burner rather than the oven to reheat food.
sentences.chinese: 加热食物时，应选用慢火炉头以代替焗炉。

sentences.english: Fry the fish until it turns golden brown on both sides. Serve hot.
sentences.chinese: 将鱼以慢火煎至两面金黄，即可上碟。

sentences.english: Add pork knuckles and simmer for 1 hour over low heat, remove and drain.
sentences.chinese: 放入猪手，以慢火煮1小时，取起沥干。

sentences.english: Let the meat cook slowly until it's tender.
Pan-fry chicken wings in 2 tbsp oil over low heat until golden yellow.
sentences.chinese: 用2汤匙油慢火将鸡翼煎至金黄香透。

sentences.english: Add pork belly and wine, simmer for 45 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 将腩肉放下汁内，加绍酒，改用中慢火炆45分钟。

sentences.english: Heat wok. Fry eggplants over low heat until both sides are golden.
sentences.chinese: 烧热镬，以慢火将两面茄子煎至金黄色。

definition: to cook in a covered vessel/to casserole/to stew
to cook slowly over a low flame/pot/saucepan
variant of 砂鍋|砂锅[sha1 guo1]
